title: Latency spike caused partial slowdown
what_happened: A major path experienced elevated delay for a short window. Users could still use the service, but it felt slow.
impact: About 18% of sessions experienced noticeable slowdown for ~16 minutes.
root_cause: A single route became congested. The system did not fail over quickly enough to avoid customer impact.
changes: Adjusted routing preference to avoid the degraded path faster
Added an early-warning alert for rising delay before users feel it
prevention: Automated “traffic shift” recommendation when delay thresholds are breached

title: Intermittent drops from one edge path
what_happened: Some users couldn’t load pages briefly. Retrying often worked, which pointed to intermittent instability rather than a total outage.
impact: Short bursts of failures for ~25 minutes affecting a subset of users.
root_cause: An edge connection showed short flaps that caused brief traffic drops.
changes: Improved detection for short bursts (not just long outages)
Added a runbook decision point: 'Is this intermittent or sustained?'
prevention: Watchlist for repeat flaps and threshold tuning
Better communication cadence during intermittent events
